question: The "Yasuni National Park" is located in which country?
explanation: Yasuni National Park is a national park located between Napo and Curaray Rivers of the Amazon forests in Ecuador. This national park lies within the Napo moist forests. It is a UNESCO designated Biosphere Reserve. This national park houses Tagaeri, Taromenane, Huaorani indigenous tribes. This national park is the most biologically diverse spot on the earth and a convergence point for three unique regions such as the Equator, Andes mountain ranges and the Amazonian rainforest. It is also home to an estimated 1.7 billion barrels of crude oil which form 40% of Ecuador's oil reserves, in which a referendum Yasuni-ITT initiative was conducted to determine whether to explore the said oil reserves or not.
